name: 03-Segmenting-And-Profiling-Customers
parameters: --var getStarted=true --var transactionType='SS','FF' --var months=01,02,03,04,05,06,07,08,09,10,11,12 --var year=2020 --var execute=true --var prepareClusterData=false --var segment=true

nodes.name: Cluster Dataset
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Infer the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Input Columns
fields.description: Input column of type - all numeric, boolean and vector

fields.name: outputCol
fields.title: Output Column
fields.description: Output column name

fields.name: handleInvalid
fields.title: Handle Invalid
fields.description: How to handle invalid data (NULL values). Options are 'skip' (filter out rows with invalid data), 'error' (throw an error), or 'keep' (return relevant number of NaN in the output).

nodes.name: Standard Scaler
nodes.description: StandardScaler transforms a dataset of Vector rows, normalizing each feature to have unit standard deviation and/or zero mean.

fields.name: inputCol

fields.name: outputCol
fields.title: Output Column
fields.description: The output column name

fields.name: withMean
fields.title: With Mean
fields.description: Centers the data with mean before scaling.

fields.name: withStd
fields.title: With Standard Dev
fields.description: Scales the data to unit standard deviation

nodes.name: K-Means
nodes.description: K-means clustering with support for k-means initialization proposed by Bahmani et al

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: modelIdentifier
fields.title: Model Identifier
fields.description: modelIdentifier starts with $loop & columns names separated with underscore. Example: $loop_columnName1_columnName2.

fields.name: featuresCol
fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting.

fields.name: k
fields.title: K
fields.description: The number of clusters to create.

fields.name: maxIter
fields.title: Max Iterations
fields.description: The maximum number of iterations.

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Random Seed.

fields.name: tol
fields.title: Tolerence
fields.description: The convergence tolerance for iterative algorithms.

fields.name: initMode
fields.title: initMode
fields.description: The initialization algorithm mode.

fields.name: initSteps
fields.title: initSteps
fields.description: The number of steps for the k-means initialization mode. It will be ignored when other initialization modes are chosen.

fields.name: distanceMeasure
fields.title: distanceMeasure
fields.description: Trait for shared param distanceMeasure

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: Weight Column

nodes.name: Join Using SQL
nodes.description: This node registers the incoming DataFrames as temporary tables and executes the SQL provided

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTables
fields.title: Temp Table Names
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT prediction as CLUSTER_ID, aa.Customer_ID, SalesOrder_Num, Invoice_Num, Product_Cd, Parent_Prd, Sales_NetAmount, INV_DATE_month
from tempTable1 aa JOIN	tempTable2 bb on aa.Customer_ID = bb.Customer_ID
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT prediction as Cluster, (count(*)/(SELECT COUNT(*) FROM fire_temp_table))*100 as Cluster_Proportion FROM fire_temp_table 
GROUP BY prediction
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

nodes.name: Sticky Note
nodes.description: Allows capturing Notes on the Workflow

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: bgColor
fields.title: Bg Color
fields.description: Background of note

fields.name: width
fields.title: Width
fields.description: Width of note

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
This workflow performs following processing:

  • Reads prepared features information
  • Creates groups of customers using K-means algorithm
  • Computes cluster profile
  • Assign Cluster information to customer based on cluster definition
  • Plots various graphs showcasing variation of features by each cluster definition

fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
